content_blocks.title: Advanced Topic Ahead

content.text: You're about to learn EDR Detection Engineering, an advanced technique used by real-world threat actors and security professionals. This knowledge is powerful and must be used ethically.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Think of this like learning advanced martial arts - powerful, but requires responsibility.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This technique is actively used in real-world attacks and defenses.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you use this knowledge to improve security?

content_blocks.title: EDR Detection Engineering

content.text: This lesson covers: Detection logic, False positive reduction, SIEM rules, Behavioral analytics. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: Detection logic enables attackers (or defenders) to building custom detection rules.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use EDR Detection Engineering daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

post_assessment.question: What is detection engineering?
options: Creating custom rules to detect specific threats
post_assessment.explanation: Detection engineering involves creating custom detection logic tailored to your environment and threats.

post_assessment.question: What's the main challenge in detection engineering?
options: Balancing detection coverage with false positive rates
post_assessment.explanation: The key challenge is detecting real threats without overwhelming analysts with false positives.
